thread.title: DCPA Off-Center invites you to join "The Wild Party" at the Stanley Marketplace
thread.title_full: DCPA Off-Center invites you to join "The Wild Party" at the Stanley Marketplace

author: Dylan Owens
title: DCPA Off-Center invites you to join "The Wild Party" at the Stanley Marketplace
text:
Print Customers enjoy food and drinks at the Stanley Beer Hall at the Stanley Marketplace on December 20, 2016 in Aurora. (Helen H. Richardson, The Denver Post) 
Heads up, jazz lovers: Michael John LaChiusa’s Tony Award-winning musical “The Wild Party” is coming to Denver. 
But per the bacchanalian setting the play plumbs, it won’t be in a stuffy theatre. 
Off-Center, the unconventional programming arm of the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, is bringing the musical to the Stanley Marketplace, the new 16,000 square-foot communal market in Aurora . Amanda Berg Wilson, the artistic director of Boulder’s the Catamounts, will direct the production, which runs Oct. 12-31. 
The musical follows a fête thrown by two vaudeville performers that descends into lascivious mayhem. Wilson’s interactive, 360-degree production will cast the audience as guests in the jazz-age party, complete with booze and a live band. 
The musical, which is Off-Center’s first, will be the series’ second production at the Stanley Marketplace. Cross-dimensional adventure comedy “Travelers of the Lost Dimension” is Off-Center’s first foray into the Stanley. It’s running right now, and wraps up on May 21. 0
